name: Point
description: The Point system provides an efficient grid-based spatial management system for tracking player proximity to locations and entities. It uses spatial partitioning for optimized performance and supports both static coordinate points and dynamic entity tracking with enter/exit callbacks.

clientFunctions.name: Register
clientFunctions.description: Creates a new point that tracks player proximity with enter/exit callbacks. Supports both static coordinates and dynamic entities.
clientFunctions.syntax: Bridge.Point.Register(id, target, distance, args, onEnter, onExit, onNearby)

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Entity handle for dynamic tracking or vector3 for static position

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Custom data to pass to callback functions

parameters.name: onEnter
parameters.description: Callback when player enters the point (point, data) -> updatedData

parameters.name: onExit
parameters.description: Callback when player exits the point (point, data) -> updatedData

parameters.name: onNearby
parameters.description: Optional callback for nearby points processing

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

-- Static coordinate point
local shopPoint = Bridge.Point.Register(
    'shop_entrance',
    vector3(100, 200, 20),
    5.0,
    {shopName = 'General Store'},
    function(point, data)
        print('Entered ' .. data.shopName)
        Bridge.Framework.ShowHelpText('Press [E] to shop')
        return data
    end,
    function(point, data)
        print('Left ' .. data.shopName)
        Bridge.Framework.HideHelpText()
        return data
    end
)

-- Dynamic entity tracking
local vehicle = GetVehiclePedIsIn(PlayerPedId(), false)
local vehiclePoint = Bridge.Point.Register(
    'my_vehicle',
    vehicle,
    3.0,
    {plate = GetVehicleNumberPlateText(vehicle)},
    function(point, data)
        print('Near vehicle: ' .. data.plate)
        return data
    end,
    function(point, data)
        print('Away from vehicle: ' .. data.plate)
        return data
    end
)

clientFunctions.name: Remove
clientFunctions.description: Removes a point by its ID and cleans up associated resources.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the point to remove

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

-- Remove a specific point
Bridge.Point.Remove('shop_entrance')
print('Shop entrance point removed')

clientFunctions.name: Get
clientFunctions.description: Retrieves a point object by its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the point to retrieve

returns.description: Point object or nil if not found

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

local point = Bridge.Point.Get('shop_entrance')
if point then
    print('Point distance: ' .. point.distance)
    print('Point inside: ' .. tostring(point.inside))
else
    print('Point not found')
end

clientFunctions.name: UpdateCoords
clientFunctions.description: Updates the coordinates of an existing point and refreshes its grid position.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the point to update

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

-- Move a point to new location
local newLocation = vector3(150, 250, 25)
Bridge.Point.UpdateCoords('shop_entrance', newLocation)
print('Point moved to new location')

clientFunctions.name: GetAll
clientFunctions.description: Returns all active points in the system.

returns.description: Table of all active points indexed by ID

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

local allPoints = Bridge.Point.GetAll()
print('Total active points: ' .. table.getn(allPoints))

for id, point in pairs(allPoints) do
    print('Point ID: ' .. id .. ', Inside: ' .. tostring(point.inside))
end

clientFunctions.name: GetNearbyCells
clientFunctions.description: Returns grid cell keys that are near the specified coordinates. Used internally for spatial optimization.

parameters.name: coords
parameters.description: Coordinates to find nearby cells for

returns.description: Array of nearby grid cell keys

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

-- Get nearby grid cells for optimization
local playerCoords = GetEntityCoords(PlayerPedId())
local nearbyCells = Bridge.Point.GetNearbyCells(playerCoords)
print('Nearby cells: ' .. #nearbyCells)

clientFunctions.name: CheckPointsInSameCell
clientFunctions.description: Returns all points in the same grid cell as the specified point for proximity checking.

returns.description: Table of nearby points in the same cell

clientFunctions.example:
local Bridge = exports['community_bridge']:Bridge()

local myPoint = Bridge.Point.Get('shop_entrance')
if myPoint then
    local nearbyPoints = Bridge.Point.CheckPointsInSameCell(myPoint)
    print('Points in same cell: ' .. table.getn(nearbyPoints))
end
